div.h4: Did you know that your Internet Explorer is out of date?
div.p: To get the best possible experience using our site we recommend that you use Google Chrome. To visit the Chrome download page, click the Get Chrome button below. Not using IE7? Refresh your browser and this message will go away!

td.div: Remote learning continues through Thursday, June 18. Read more.

div.h1: In-person instruction is suspended for the rest of the school year

div.p: We have redesigned our homepage and blog to make it easier for you to find CPS information and resources and stay connected to what’s happening in the district.
Key changes:

ul.li: The Contacts link to the CPS directory has been moved to the top right corner of the homepage, next to the Select Language utility.
The link to the Careers section has been moved from the footer to the primary navigation bar.
We added Resources, a dropdown menu on the navigation, which enables visitors to directly connect to primary department sites and our most frequently used applications.

We developed a new section called Explore CPS to provide immediate access to district information, tools and utilities to research, locate, and reach CPS schools, and to learn more about our vision, priorities and goals for the coming year.

div.p: We welcome your comments and suggestions for improving this site.
Chicago Public School students are achieving at record levels. By any measure and subgroup, our students are progressing academically.

div.h2: Important Notices on Special Education Services

div.p: The Office of Diverse Learner Supports and Services outlines the Student Specific Corrective Action process that will take place at annual IEP meetings during the 2019–20 school year.
CPS is committed to providing transportation as a related service to all eligible preschool students with disabilities to and from and between locations other than their home.
In partnership with the Chicago Department of Health and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the district is working to ensure our schools are safe for students and staff.

img.alt: A little girl reading a book at a kids table.

div.p: Grade-level activity packets for PreK-12th grade to support student learning during the Coronavirus school closures.

img.alt: A family speaking to a school counselor

div.p: Resources, tools, social services, community supports, and parent education to increase parent and student engagement and advance student success.

img.alt: A family of three viewing information on a tablet

div.p: Information, tools, and resources to research, explore, compare, rank, and apply to nearly every CPS school and program in SY 2019-20.

img.alt: A group of students in the lunchroom smiling and giving the thumbs up

div.p: Policies and guidelines on student behavior, restorative discipline practices, expanded anti-bullying protections, and incident reporting.
Plans and updates from the Office of Student Protections and Title IX, on the steps CPS is taking to ensure student safety and well being.

div.h4: A Budget That Focuses on Equity (Spanish)
div.p: As part of our continued commitment to equity, our budget is focused on supporting students who need us most. Hundreds of South and West Side schools will receive new academic programs, technology, preschool programs, modernized school facilities, science labs, and play spaces.

Equity means students who need more should get more. In fact, 93% of our capital budget dollars will go to schools whose student population is majority low-income. This is what equity looks like—investments for all corners of our city.
Learn more about how our budget focuses on equity at cps.edu/budget
At Chicago Public Schools, our mission is to provide a high quality public education for every child, in every neighborhood, that prepares each for success in college, career and civic life.
Find detailed info about a school, including programs and admissions requirements, after school activities, family support services, and school performance reports.
Research CPS schools to find the academic programs and school environments that best meet the needs of your child.
Find your neighborhood schools, view neighborhood attendance boundaries, and conduct proximity searches to find the CPS schools nearest you.

div.p: Chicago Public Schools is the third largest school district in the United States with more than 600 schools and serves 361,000 children. Our vision is that every student in every neighborhood will be engaged in a rigorous, well-rounded instructional program and will graduate prepared for success in college, career and life.

div.h4: Look for us in your inbox shortly.
